panels.description: Quick pulse check - Is the database alive and accepting writes? Like a paramedic checking vitals, this verifies the database responds to real read/write operations.
panels.title: Health Status

panels.description: Database write capability - R/W means accepting writes (primary), READ-ONLY means replica/standby/maintenance mode. No data means healthy read-write primary.
panels.title: Database Mode

panels.description: Current database server version reported by dbpulse. The Stat shows the series name which contains the database and version labels.
panels.title: Database Version

panels.description: Database uptime in seconds since the server last started (translation of pg_postmaster_start_time / SHOW GLOBAL STATUS LIKE 'Uptime').
panels.title: Database Uptime

panels.description: How long since the database last passed a complete health check (connection, read, write, transaction test). Low values indicate healthy continuous operation.
panels.title: Time Since Last Success

panels.description: Database connections currently open by dbpulse. Should normally be 0 between checks. Red (1+) during active health check is normal.
panels.title: Active Connections

panels.description: Number of queries currently blocking others. Should normally be 0.
panels.title: Blocking Queries

panels.description: Error rate over the last 5 minutes across authentication, timeout, connection and query failures.
panels.title: Error Rate (5m)

panels.description: Complete health check duration from connection to cleanup. Includes all operations: connect, read, write, transaction test, and cleanup. Typical: 50-200ms.
panels.title: Overall Latency

panels.description: Breakdown of time spent on individual operations (connect, insert, select, transaction_test, cleanup). Helps identify which operation is slow.
panels.title: Operation Duration Breakdown

panels.description: How long database connections are held open during health checks. Shorter is better - indicates efficient connection usage and cleanup.
panels.title: Connection Duration

panels.description: Rate of database write activity from health checks. Inserts verify write capability, deletes keep table size bounded. Steady rate indicates consistent monitoring.
panels.title: Rows Affected Rate

panels.description: Size of the monitoring table (dbpulse_rw). Automatic cleanup keeps this small. Growth indicates cleanup issues or very frequent checks.
panels.title: Table Size (MB)

panels.description: Number of rows in monitoring table. Old records (>1 hour) are automatically deleted. High counts may indicate cleanup issues or disabled hourly table drop.
panels.title: Table Row Count

panels.description: Replication lag on replica/standby databases. Only appears for read-only databases. No data means this is a primary (good). Low values (<5s) indicate healthy replication.

defaults.noValue: No replication lag - this is a primary database

panels.title: Replication Lag

panels.description: Queries currently blocking others due to locks. Zero is normal and expected. Non-zero indicates lock contention (DDL, long transactions, or table locks).
panels.title: Blocking Queries

panels.description: Pulse status (0=error, 1=success) with latest runtime per database on the right axis.
panels.title: Pulse & Runtime

panels.description: Total database size including all tables and indexes. Useful for capacity planning. No data means size query not supported or insufficient permissions.
panels.title: Database Size

panels.description: Time to complete TLS handshake during connection. Only appears when TLS is enabled (sslmode=require/verify-ca/verify-full). No data means TLS is disabled.
panels.title: TLS Handshake Duration

panels.description: Rate of TLS-specific connection errors (handshake failures, certificate issues). Only relevant when TLS is enabled. No data means no TLS errors (good) or TLS disabled.

defaults.noValue: No TLS errors - TLS disabled or working correctly

panels.title: TLS Connection Errors

panels.description: Active TLS connection details (version: TLSv1.2/1.3, cipher suite). Only populated when TLS is enabled. No data means TLS is disabled (sslmode=disable).
panels.title: TLS Connection Info

panels.description: Rate of errors by category (authentication, timeout, connection, transaction, query). Stacked view shows total error rate and breakdown by type.
panels.title: Error Rate by Type

panels.description: Rate of health check iterations by outcome (success vs error). Green area should dominate. Growing red area indicates database problems.
panels.title: Iterations (Success vs Error)

panels.description: Internal panic recovery count. Should always be zero. Non-zero indicates bugs in dbpulse that need investigation.
panels.title: Panics Recovered

panels.description: Distribution of errors by category. Helps identify if errors are concentrated in one area (auth, timeout, connection, etc.).
panels.title: Error Distribution
